cursor.description: Used for pagination.  When a list request has more records available, cursors are provided in the response headers `X-Files-Cursor-Next` and `X-Files-Cursor-Prev`.  Send one of those cursor value here to resume an existing list from the next available record.  Note: many of our SDKs have iterator methods that will automatically handle cursor-based pagination.

per_page.description: Number of records to show per page.  (Max: 10,000, 1,000 or less is recommended).

sort_by.description: If set, sort records by the specified field in either `asc` or `desc` direction (e.g. `sort_by[logged_at]=desc`). Valid fields are `logged_at`.

filter.description: If set, return records where the specified field is equal to the supplied value. Valid fields are `logged_at`.

filter_gt.description: If set, return records where the specified field is greater than the supplied value. Valid fields are `logged_at`.

filter_gteq.description: If set, return records where the specified field is greater than or equal the supplied value. Valid fields are `logged_at`.

filter_lt.description: If set, return records where the specified field is less than the supplied value. Valid fields are `logged_at`.

filter_lteq.description: If set, return records where the specified field is less than or equal the supplied value. Valid fields are `logged_at`.

$ul: **logged_at**: Time the site bandwidth report was logged
**sync_bytes_received**: Site sync bandwidth report bytes received
**sync_bytes_sent**: Site sync bandwidth report bytes sent
